Sylph::null

Sylph::null Struct Reference

null is a safe null pointer. More...

#include </Users/frank/Dropbox/sylph/src/Sylph/Core/Object.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

null is a safe null pointer.

It can only be assigned to pointers, not to ints. Therefore, no overload confusion can happen. E.g.: 

 #define NULL 0
 int* i1 = NULL; // works
 int  i2 = NULL; // works too, but maybe not what you want

 #undef NULL
 #define NULL ((void*)0)
 int* i3 = NULL; // does not work
 int* i4 = (int*)NULL; // needs explicit cast in C++
 int  i5 = NULL; // does not work -- like expected

 int* i5 = null; // works
 int  i6 = null; // does not work -- like expected
